greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Least number k such that sopfr(k) - sopf(k) = k/n, -1 if such a number does not exist.
comment: Values equal to -1 are hypothetical (tested up to 2*10^10 by _Giovanni Resta_).
example: a(6) = 12 because 12 is the least number such that sopfr(12) - sopf(12) = 7 - 5 = 2 = 12/6.
maple: with(numtheory): P:=proc(q) local a, j, k, n;
for n from 2 to q do for j from n by n to q do
lprint(n,j); break; fi; od; od; end: P(10^6);
mathematica: Table[SelectFirst[Range[n^3], Function[k, Total@ # - Total@ Union@ # == k/n &@ Flatten@ Map[ConstantArray[#1, #2] & @@ # &, #] &@ FactorInteger@ k]] /. k_ /; MissingQ@ k -> -1, {n, 2, 58}] (* Version 10.2, or *)

Table[k = 1; While[And[Total@ # - Total@ Union@ # != k/n, k <= n^3] &@ Flatten@ Map[ConstantArray[#1, #2] & @@ # &, #] &@ FactorInteger@ k, k++]; If[k > n^3, -1, k], {n, 2, 58}] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Dec 28 2016 *)
results.author: _Paolo P. Lava_, Dec 27 2016
